intro: Asplenium radiatum, commonly known as the radiate spleenwort, is a small, evergreen fern that belongs to the Aspleniaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant produces sporangia in clusters on the underside of its leaves, which are arranged in a distinctive radiating pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on rocks or in crevices. Asplenium radiatum is a common epiphytic or lithophytic species found in temperate regions across the globe.
